newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Nigeria and China sign deal on oil cooperation.
newsitem.headline: Nigeria and China sign deal on oil cooperation.

text.p: China has signed a cooperation agreement with Nigeria on crude oil exploration and production, the national news agency reported on Wednesday.

The News Agency of Nigeria said the agreement includes the possibility of Chinese acquisition of concessions in the northern Lake Chad basin as well as deep offshore and in marginal oil fields not currently being exploited.
"The CNPC (Chinese National Petroleum Corporation) will also establish an outfit for the manufacturing of drilling equipment, rigs and seismic data acquisition equipment in Nigeria," the agency said.
CNPC officials signed the agreement in Lagos on Wednesday with the petroleum ministry and Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC).
Nigeria currently pumps around two million barrels of crude oil per day, largely in conjunction with western joint-venture partners.

Under pressure from western countries for its record on human rights and democracy, Nigeria has increasingly turned away from its traditional trading partners towards China, Eastern Europe and the Middle East.
